data.title: "Please Confirm..." "Exit the editor?" [cancel] [quit]
data.body:
(thanks for a crazy cool tool!)

Linux Ubuntu 16.04.1 x86_64 running MATE desktop.
Godot version "Godot_v2.1-stable_x11.64"

If I have _not changed anything in a scene_ (eg. i just loaded it; or i used 'undo' enough times), when I go to quit that scene editor, the system should _not_ ask me to "Please Confirm..." etc.

When it does ask, that is scary UX to the end user because they have no way of being sure thing are saved or not since we're apparently always asked.

data.title: Redo the creation of the root node doesn't updates the scene tree
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

When I delete the root node, then undo, then redo, the node is created again but not shown in the hierarchy. Adding a second node shows the tree again.

Repro:
1) Create empty scene
2) Add a root node
3) Undo
4) Redo: notice the node doesn't appears

data.title: Numpad Enter Not Working for Auto-complete
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Linux Mint 64-bit, Godot Release v2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

If you bring up auto-complete in the code editor, you can't use the Numpad's enter to choose an entry; you have to use the center Enter key. It'd be nice if you could use either.

data.title: AnimationPlayer.seek() Flooding Debug Console
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Linux Mint 64-bit, Godot v2.1 Release

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

If you use AnimationPlayer.seek() when it hasn't played an animation, it will flood the console with the message `Condition ' lplayback.current.from ' is true`. Simply checking to see if `AnimationPlayer.get_current_animation() != ""` works to avoid this.

What might be a better solution is either to throw an error stating that the AnimationPlayer needs to be playing an animation to `seek()`, or perhaps better yet, to simply disregard the function call internally if an animation has yet to be played.

data.title: Auto scroll Input Map when adding new actions
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Godot 2.1 Stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I would like the Input Map screen to auto scroll to the bottom whenever a new action is added. It would make the workflow more efficient.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open Scene -> Project Settings
2. Select Input Map
3. Add a new action
4. Scroll to the bottom and click + on the action to map it to a key/button etc

I guess this would be low priority but it would be nice.

data.title: connect() autocompletion for custom signals
data.body:
It would be nice if the autocompletion for connect() function included user-defined signals(with the "signal" keyword).
Like

```
signal my_signal

func _ready()
     connect( *this would suggest "my_signal" as well* , self, "_on_my_signal")
```

data.title: This allows building when ALSA libs are in a non-standard location. PK…
data.body:
…G_CONFIG_PATH alone is not enough as the final link fails. Adding this makes the final link succeed.

It seems like the correct way to handle this situation.  But I don't know SCons really at all so there may be some settings that are not getting propagated all the way through all the build steps. Just to reiterate the build progresses all the way to the end but fails at the final application link stage.

Here's my build command:

PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/path/to/alsalib/lib/pkgconfig:$PKG_CONFIG_PATH scons -j 4 platform=x11 tools=yes bits=64 2>&1 | tee make.log

data.title: Feature request for Visual Scripting: Copy, Cut and Paste nodes between the scripts
data.body:
I tried to select the nodes and press Ctrl + C for copy or Ctrl + X for cut and in another script Ctrl + V for paste: nothing happens...

It's an important feature because text-based GDScript allows you refactor code easily by copy and pasting code around, so :)

So far I'm having a blast with Visual Scripting, thank you for making it happen!

data.title: x11: Use proper sonames for loading libXrandr.
Middle click on functions to open docs
data.body:
When I was learning how to use game maker (or checking other people's code) I always made use of a nice feature of the code editor: when you use your middle mouse click you open the docs entry of that particular function/class you clicked.
It can also be opened from the right click menu.

So, if you have a "extends Node2D" at the top and you want to check the docs for that class you can click on it and read it instead of going to the docs tab and typing the class name.

I would love to contribute to the UI but I'm still getting used to source code.

data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Put the engine on steam as a free download like blender, to help spread the word about it and gather new volunteers along the way

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use early access on steam to submit the project.

data.title: EditorPlugin node is not present in 'create new node' window
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.0 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Since this https://github.com/gau-veldt/godot/commit/c73014bf1d1458d8d470dec8ab87df2aef3be5fa commit `EditorPlugin` node is not present in `Create new node` dialog window. The commit was a fix for https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3263 issue, but I think it was to wide and this node was not meant to be hidden in first place.  As far as I can see other nodes probably hidden by this commit probably indeed were not intended for users to be use, but `EditorPlugin` node is quite crucial when creating tool scripts, and necessity to add it each time to the tree from script and not beeing able to make it scene root feels little dirty to me.  
Besides it even has cool icon that was meant to be presented in inspector :)

data.title: shortcut parity with blender(or sync/import config)
data.body:
its a bit anoying to have different shortcuts for any program i use, it break the workflow.
there is anyway to import an configuration file defining shortcuts for common features? 
(eg: blender use: g for translate, r for rotate, s for scale)

or to export the godot shortcut config to blender? (or keep their configuration sync)

data.title: MidDPI?
data.body:
I have a really weird laptop, it's 1920x1080 but the screen is physically small, so LoDPI makes text really tiny and HiDPI makes it really big to the point of being unusable, so my question is:

Is there any possibility of adding MidDPI (150% scaling) mode?

Thanks!

data.title: "signal already connected" error in inherited scenes
data.body:
**Godot version:** 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When running an inherited scene, any signals that are connected in the original scene throw a "signal already connected" error. It looks like in an inherited scene, Godot tries to connect the signals twice.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new scene, add at least one node and a script. 
2. In the "signals" tab, connect any node signal to a script function.
3. Save the scene and create a new scene that inherits from it.
4. Run the original scene -> no error.
5. Run the inherited scene -> "signal already connected" error.

**Link to minimal example project**:
[signal_inherited_scene.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/411619/signal_inherited_scene.zip)

data.title: Logical folders in Project List
data.body:
Hello guys,
in a past weeks I collected a lot of demos and example projects for Godot and I have them all loaded to Project List. But having 50+ projects in the list became confusing and harder to browse (even though ability to favourite is useful). So I ask if it is possible to add logical folders to Project List so me and some other hoarders could better organize their projects.

data.title: Editor unusable with multiple screens on OS X
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.11.6, Gotot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
2nd screen attached via HDMI. Main screen is Retina MacBookPro screen (13"). Secondary screen is DELL HD (1080p) monitor.
I want to use the 2ndary screen to place the editor window.
The 2ndary screen is not a HI DPI (Retina) screen. But Godot still seems to apply the Retina scale factor. I.e. it doesn't determine that the window was dragged to a screen w/o a scale factor.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open Godot.
Editor opens fine on primary (laptop) Retina screen
Drag window to 2ndary screen. Window turns white.
Window is redrawn after 1-2 seconds. Part of editor is missing (see 1st attached screen shot)
Resize Window to fill full 2ndary screen. Editor is scaled and unusable (see 2nd attached screen shot)
![screen shot 2016-08-10 at 14 53 42 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/387036/17554314/9b2db6ac-5f0a-11e6-8799-4ccce5085f0c.png)
![screen shot 2016-08-10 at 14 53 50 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/387036/17554321/a1302224-5f0a-11e6-8971-10e176b74e5c.png)

data.title: single in_app_store (ios, android)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
godot 2.x

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
At the moment, there is support "INAPP" engine out of the box. In like some strange reason, on different platforms, it has a different interface and not implemented as a single unit but as two completely independent module. Will correctly if all unite and make one unit with a single interface.
The same applies to the "leaderboards". Which iOS they have and to Android unfortunately they are not. And still need "achievements".
All this functionality is fundamental to the mobile platform and perhaps even more important than the visual programming.
PS
Pay attention to this problem please: #6057
